slides.title: The Scientific Revolution
slides.content:
# New Way üî≠

1543-1687.
A shift from trusting Authority (Aristotle/Bible) to trusting Observation and Reason.
- Copernicus to Newton.

slides.title: Copernicus
slides.content:
# Sun Center ‚òÄÔ∏è

1543: *On the Revolutions of the Celestial Spheres*.
- **Heliocentric Model**: Earth goes around Sun.
- Challenged 1000 years of belief.
- Published on his deathbed to avoid persecution.

slides.title: Galileo Galilei
slides.content:
# The Observer üî≠

- Improved Telescope.
- Saw: Moons of Jupiter (Earth not only center!), Phases of Venus, Sunspots.
- Tried by Inquisition: "And yet it moves."

slides.title: Francis Bacon
slides.content:
# Scientific Method üß™

- **Empiricism**: Knowledge comes from sensory experience.
- Inductive Reasoning.
- "Knowledge is Power".

slides.title: Isaac Newton
slides.content:
# Gravity üçé

1687: *Principia Mathematica*.
- **Laws of Motion**.
- **Universal Gravitation**: Same force pulls apple and keeps Moon in orbit.
- Invented Calculus (with Leibniz).
- Unified Heaven and Earth physics.

slides.title: Motion Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Who formulated the Laws of Motion and Universal Gravitation?

slides.title: Chemistry Revolution
slides.content:
# Elements ‚öõÔ∏è

- **Antoine Lavoisier**: Identified Oxygen. Law of Conservation of Mass.
- **Dmitri Mendeleev**: Periodic Table (1869). Predicted missing elements.
- Alchemy finally became Chemistry.

slides.title: Darwin and Evolution
slides.content:
# Origin of Species üê¢

1859.
- **Natural Selection**: Survival of the fittest.
- All life shares a common ancestor.
- Changed Biology forever.

slides.title: Germ Theory
slides.content:
# Invisible Enemies ü¶†

- **Louis Pasteur**: Germs cause disease (not bad smells/miasma). Pasteurization.
- **Robert Koch**: Identifies specific bacteria for Anthrax, TB.
- **Joseph Lister**: Antiseptic surgery.

slides.title: Electromagnetism
slides.content:
# Sparks ‚ö°

- **Michael Faraday**: Induction (Motor/Generator).
- **James Clerk Maxwell**: Equations uniting Electricity, Magnetism, and Light.
- Powered the industrial world.

slides.title: Industrial Revolution
slides.content:
# Machines üöÇ

- **Steam Engine** (James Watt): Heat $\to$ Work.
- Factories, Trains, Electricity.
- Science applied to production.

slides.title: Marie Curie
slides.content:
# Radioactivity ‚ò¢Ô∏è

- Discovered Radium and Polonium.
- Only person to win Nobel Prize in two different sciences (Physics & Chemistry).
- Died from her own discovery.

slides.title: Bio Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Was Germ Theory accepted before the 19th Century?

slides.title: Quantum Mechanics
slides.content:
# Weird Physics üé≤

Early 20th Century.
- Planck, Einstein, Bohr, Heisenberg.
- Energy is quantized.
- Particles are Probability waves.
- Uncertainty Principle.

slides.title: Einstein's Relativity
slides.content:
# Space-Time ‚è≥

1905/1915.
- **Special**: Time slows down when you move fast ($E=mc^2$).
- **General**: Gravity is bending of space-time.
- Replaced Newton's fixed universe.

slides.title: DNA Structure
slides.content:
# Double Helix üß¨

1953: Watson, Crick, Franklin, Wilkins.
- Mechanism of heredity found.
- Molecular Biology begins.
- Genome sequencing follows.

slides.title: The Digital Age
slides.content:
# Computers üíª

- **Turing**: Mathematical logic.
- **Transistor** (1947): Bell Labs.
- **Internet**.
- Information Revolution.

slides.title: Big Science
slides.content:
# Megaprojects üöÄ

Science became too big for one person.
- **Manhattan Project** (nuke).
- **Apollo** (Moon).
- **CERN** (Particle Accelerator).
- **Human Genome Project**.

slides.title: Modern Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- We moved from **Philosophy** to **Experiment**.
- Technology exploded.
- We unlocked the atom and the gene.
- Exponential growth of knowledge.
